result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G Mundt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Domestic abuse and DNA surcharges imposed. 
Cash bond applied. 
Balance due in 60 days.

Granted release privileges under 303.08(1). 
Execution of the sentence is stayed for not more than 30 days or until a date set by the Waupaca County Huber Law Officer, which ever date occurs first.  The defendant shall report to the Waupaca County Jail on the sentencing date to confirm a reporting date with the Waupaca County Huber Law Officer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert G Mundt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert G Mundt in court with attorney Earl John Luaders. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Court questioned defendant and advised of rights. 
No contest plea entered to Count 1. 
State has complied with victim rights notifications. 
Court accepts plea to Count 1 and finds defendant guilty. 
Count 2 is dismissed and read in by the Court. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Defendant is rejecting probation. 
Statement by the defendant to the Court. 
Court sentences the defendant to Waupaca County Jail for a period of 30 days. 
Defendant is granted Huber privileges. 
Sentence to begin within next 30 days, but should report today to arrange. 
Defendant to further pay costs of the action within 60 days. 
Advised of appeal rights.

Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present
Defendant: Nonappearance
Attorney Earl Luaders: Present via phone
Complaint received.
Waive reading of complaint.
Bond continued.
Plea Not Guilty
STC to be set by BR2 - date requested

To Plea - Not Guilty 
Atty Earl Luaders

And Entry of Plea - Not Guilty
